King_Caspar.description: The painting represents one of the three magi who came to worship the Christ child.
King_Caspar.more_info: King Caspar depicts the Biblical King from the Adoration of the Magi holding his gift of frankincense in a precious vessel.

Turban.painting_name: Head of a Boy in a Turban
Turban.description: The painting depicts an endearing tronie of a young boy dressed in a fantasy costume, who looks at us over his shoulder.
Turban.more_info: Dou was Rembrandt's first pupil and took up his master's idea of studying black people.

Dom_Miguel.painting_name: Portrait of Dom Miguel de Castro
Dom_Miguel.description: Dom Miguel de Castro makes here a powerful, serious expression. He was a member of the Congolese elite.
Dom_Miguel.more_info: This portrait was commissioned by the Dutch West India Company during his two week stay in Middelburg.

Pedro_Sunda.description: Pedro Sunda holds an elephant's tusk. Ivory was one of the Congo's major export products.
Pedro_Sunda.more_info: The status of these young men is unclear. Were they assistants of the noble Dom Miguel or were they enslaved?

Diego_Bemba.description: Diego Bemba holds a small casket, probably a diplomatic gift. He was one of Don Miguel de Castro's servants.
Diego_Bemba.more_info: His eyes are turned upwards as if he were addressing or giving thanks to God, suggesting the box contains something holy.

King Caspar.name: King Caspar
King Caspar.description: One of the three magi who came to worship the Christ child. The three magi visited Jesus bearing precious gifts.

Incense Pot.name: Incense Pot
Incense Pot.description: The golden pot represents an incense pot, a gift for Jesus. Frankincense embodied Jesus' deity.

Necklace.name: Necklace
Necklace.description: Golden necklace representing high power and status. The 17th century was the age of elegance for accessories.

Earring.name: Earring
Earring.description: Golden earring representing high power and status of the wearer.

Ring.name: Ring
Ring.description: Finely carved ring worn by nobles. Carefully selected statement pieces showed taste in the 17th century.

Doublet.name: Doublet
Doublet.description: Yellow doublet paired with an intricately detailed and jewelled cloak. A form-fitted waist length jacket.

Gemstones.name: Gemstones
Gemstones.description: Due to expanding global trade in the 17th century, gemstones became more available and were used extensively.

Turban.name: Turban
Turban.description: A type of headwear constructed by winding cloth, made from strong fabrics like cotton.

White ostrich feather.name: White ostrich feather
White ostrich feather.description: Decoration on the turban. A white feather is seen as a sign of hope or peace in many cultures.

Blue garment.name: Blue garment
Blue garment.description: Fantasy costume with 17th century elements. Blue was the most lavish pigment, representing power and royalty.

Young boy.name: Young boy
Young boy.description: An endearing tronie of a young boy in fantasy costume looking over his shoulder at the viewer.

Red ostrich feather.name: Red ostrich feather
Red ostrich feather.description: Symbol of elegance and luxurious extravagance. Red was associated with wealth and power.

Cavalier hat.name: Cavalier hat
Cavalier hat.description: Wide-brimmed hat from the 17th century, often made from felt and accentuated with ostrich feathers.

Gilt garment.name: Gilt garment
Gilt garment.description: Ornately decorated with silver gilt embroidery using metal threads, symbolizing wealth and elegance.

Dom Miguel.name: Dom Miguel
Dom Miguel.description: Dom Miguel de Castro, a member of the Congolese elite with a powerful, serious expression.

Ivory tusk.name: Ivory tusk
Ivory tusk.description: Elephant tusk held by Pedro Sunda. Ivory was valuable due to its beauty and durability, representing strength and power.

Pedro Sunda.name: Pedro Sunda
Pedro Sunda.description: Servant of the Congolese envoy Don Miguel de Castro. Portraits of named servants from Africa are rare.

Cloth.name: Cloth
Cloth.description: Green velvet suit with golden ribbons and buttons. Dressed according to European fashion of the 1640s.

Box.name: Box
Box.description: Small decorative casket assumed to be a diplomatic gift, more than functional packaging with artistic elements.

Diego Bemba.name: Diego Bemba
Diego Bemba.description: One of Don Miguel de Castro's servants, pointing at the box with his eyes turned upward.

Clothes.name: Clothes
Clothes.description: Same type of European fashion as Pedro Sunda, body turned slightly to the right in framing shadows.
